conversation_summary: Amber resin beads drip from a swollen moon onto the campsite bowl. You cradle a crystalline skeleton lamp; its良多-faced glow stitches friends’ flicker-age faces into one circle around the empty fire pit. Molly’s cardboard cone lies discarded; her resin-streaked hands show how cracked stones pool into permanent sunset when bound. Fossilized laughter bells ring from the log, marking time that chooses to harden rather than pass.
